alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 02 at 4:40AM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST AND NUNIVAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds 30 to 40 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph. Visibilities reduced to one-quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast and Nunivak Island. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds may cause damage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and lowest visibilities with falling snow are expected to be late tonight into early Wednesday morning before conditions slowly improve later Wednesday morning as the front continues moving northward..
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
